kwoot - (09:19): Good morning everyone. I had an idea this weekend and want to check if you think it is worth making a Jira ticket for:  
kwoot - (09:20): adding a symbol for the newline character in the wiki-syntax-edit-mode. Sometimes it is unclear if there is a newline in the code. A special character/symbol shown for a newline can be very helpfull.  
Stulle - (09:20): hi, i keep getting a weird error on importing a file via the importer function: http://pastebin.ca/1966623  
Stulle - (09:21): any suggestions?  
cjdelisle - (09:22): That's not an error I have seen before, what is the content which causes it to occur?  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:24  
cjdelisle - (09:24): kwoot, I'm not sure if it's possible to change the display of the \n char. If you know a way, by all means create an idea jira issue.  
kwoot - (09:24): cjdelisle: will do. What section does this belong in?  
Stulle - (09:25): cjdelisle: basically it's just a word file that includes a picture (original is png) and some formulas (MS Equations)  
Stulle - (09:25): actually the error started popping up yesterday  
Stulle - (09:26): then it was just plain text without a lot of fancy formating... basically just a couple of bold, some headings and a few links in those docs  
cjdelisle - (09:27): kwoot, it would be in the core project and in the "component" menu, choose "Templates and User Interface"  
cjdelisle - (09:28): Stulle, are you trying to import a word document by copy-pasting it to the editor?  
Stulle - (09:30): nope, first i tried WYSIWYG import and then i tried Add Page Import  
Stulle - (09:30): but the error remains the same  
cjdelisle - (09:30): IIRC, someone had some trouble with that but using OfficeImporter worked ok.

Stulle - (09:31): some time after i switched to the RC1  
Stulle - (09:32): although, IIRC, it did work at first but then suddenly fucked up  
Stulle - (09:32): brb  
cjdelisle - (09:32): But if you have a page saved and it causes the error every time you view it, try editing it as wiki mode and get the code.  
cjdelisle - (09:32): The renderer should not be throwing exceptions so anything which causes it to is of interest to us.  
cjdelisle - (09:33): tmortagne, do you recognize this? http://pastebin.ca/1966623  
tmortagne - (09:35): cjdelisle: yes i do, what version of xwiki core is this ?  
cjdelisle - (09:35): RC1  
cjdelisle - (09:35): This is Stulle's problem.  
tmortagne - (09:37): hmm actually no i don't recognize precisely (mixed with another one), in any case as cjdelisle said any error in the xhtml parser is an important bug (it should never fail whatever the content) so it would be great if you could create an issue on http://jira.xwiki.org and i will look at that  
tmortagne - (09:37): ( Stulle )  
Stulle - (09:38): re  
kwoot - (09:38): okay. done. it is XWIKI-5593  
Stulle - (09:39): okay, the thing is i cannot switch to wiki mode in the WYIWYG editor after importing  
kwoot - (09:39): BTW: Love the crypto stuff!  
Stulle - (09:39): and importing via page add is not working either  
cjdelisle - (09:40): You're using it?  
cjdelisle - (09:40): (crypto)  
tmortagne - (09:40): Stulle: according to the error, th issue is in the XHTML parser not in wiki syntax parser, so what is needed is the XHTML (and that's why you can't convert from xhtml to wiki syntax)  
Stulle - (09:41): okay  
Stulle - (09:41): i'll create a ticket  
cjdelisle - (09:42): If there is sensitive information in the document, you can try removing/replacing it and see what will still cause the error.  
tmortagne - (09:42): Stulle: the best is that you provide in the jira issue a way to reproduce it all the time and it wil be fixed very easily  
Stulle - (09:42): okay, will do  
Stulle - (09:42): i'll just take another document that fails that has less material that might upset any organization (such as the ISO or IEC or so ;))

Stulle - (09:54): okay, did not know, sorry for that

sburjan - (10:56): I have an unrelated question: does anybody have any idea is HSQLDB or the JDBC driver has any build-in default on protection against multiple SQL queries that are executed in the same string ?  
cjdelisle - (10:57): IIRC hsql no. Mysql yes.  
cjdelisle - (10:58): allowMultiQueries is the mysql config parameter I think.  
sburjan - (10:58): because I created a hsqldb app, but I not allowed to put multiple queries in the same string before execute()  
sburjan - (10:59): I want to demonstrate how SQL Injection works (school project)  
sburjan - (10:59): so basically i am able to print the database, but unable to make another select, drop, alter, insert  
cjdelisle - (11:00): no pb, just abuse union ;)  
cjdelisle - (11:01): '); drop table wxyz; commit; is dramatic but not what injection is usually after.  
sburjan - (11:01): this is exactly I want to do .. drop a table :D  
sburjan - (11:02): my problem is that the string I constructed end with a hardcoded '  
cjdelisle - (11:02): Oh you need to get rid of a trailing ' char?  
sburjan - (11:02): so I'll have to put something at the end that needs closing  
sburjan - (11:03): well my string is constructed like this ("select \* from users where user ='" + username"' and password = '"password"';");  
sburjan - (11:03): something like this  
sburjan - (11:03): so the last ' is hardcoded in the query  
cjdelisle - (11:03): oh, so easy.  
cjdelisle - (11:04): password = "' or 1=1 or '' = '"  
sburjan - (11:04): basically I'd like to run : select + drop + something else that closes the '  
sburjan - (11:04): thanks  
cjdelisle - (11:05): oh that'll just give you admin. You need to drop a table. hmm.  
sburjan - (11:05): I'll try it these days  
cjdelisle - (11:05): This is the fun one:  
cjdelisle - (11:05): SELECT document.name from documents where document.type = '$userInput'  
cjdelisle - (11:06): $userInput = ...  can I remember....  
cjdelisle - (11:07): ' UNION ALL users --  
sburjan - (11:07): I'm limited to a user/password select \* query  
sburjan - (11:07): what is the -- mea ?  
cjdelisle - (11:07): comment out the rest of the line.  
sburjan - (11:07): I'veseen it in tutorials, but they never explained what was that  
sburjan - (11:07): oh  
cjdelisle - (11:08): dropping a table is a requirement?  
cjdelisle - (11:08): http://81.22.99.132/sql-injection-cheatsheet-oku/page/3/ hehe love that.  
sburjan - (11:09): basically I have a jsp, form, 2 input fields (user/pass) pressing the login button redirect to a servlet that makes the query, prints the queryString and print the ResultSet  
sburjan - (11:09): and I can bypass it using anything' or 'a'='a  
sburjan - (11:09): and I get the select to get the whole table  
sburjan - (11:09): but unable to drop or insert :(  
sburjan - (11:11): basically no even 2 selects in the same query don;t work  
sburjan - (11:11): so I'm guessing there is some setting which allows only one query / execute()  
cjdelisle - (11:11): postgres or oracle are more fun. you can add a function to the database to email you all the passwords which are entered in the future.  
sburjan - (11:12): lol  
sburjan - (11:12): that's just sad  
cjdelisle - (11:13): Functions are cool but easy to abuse.  
sburjan - (11:13): but usually who enables these kinds of security measures (I'm talking about java) .. it's the JDBC driver that blocks this, or the DB Engine ?  
cjdelisle - (11:14): the db engine is probably where you want to look.  
cjdelisle - (11:14): postgres supports ); drop table students; commit; --  
sburjan - (11:15): well .. my string closes a ' .. so I have to generate a query that need an ending ', right ?  
sburjan - (11:16): == won't ignore the hardcoded ' :)  
cjdelisle - (11:16): http://www.hsqldb.org/doc/guide/ch09.html#N124ED  
cjdelisle - (11:17): oh very fun. user = "r00t' --"  
cjdelisle - (11:18): hmm mysql is picky about the number of ' marks even if they're in comments.  
cjdelisle - (11:18): dunno about hsql  
sburjan - (11:18): well i chose hsql in the idea that it was the dumbest :)  
sburjan - (11:19): so I could do anything  
cjdelisle - (11:20): first rule of hacking is attack proprietary software ;)  
sburjan - (11:20): All these types of comments are ignored by the database.

kwoot - (11:37): cjdelisle: regarding your earlier crypto question. I look forward to trying it out to have managers here sign pages to give it some official status. sorry for delay in answer. trying to do some other work here :-)  
cjdelisle - (11:38): no pb. Great to hear someone's talking about using it.  
cjdelisle - (11:39): You know if everyone has an email cert for PKCS7 then you can sign things from in the browser with js and the key never has to even sit on the server.  
cjdelisle - (11:40): The only limitation is everyone has to trust their own key (firefox sillyness) which is not too difficult if you have a company CA.  
kwoot - (11:41): cjdelisle: fact of life: harddisks wear out. So if some user has a  workstattion with a old disc he looses his key.  
cjdelisle - (11:42): true enough. but another fact is that most attacks fall on the server so you can't trust a key on a server as much as one in a browser.  
cjdelisle - (11:42): s/request/response/  
kwoot - (11:46): all true. Now if only there was a good solution :-)  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:48  
cjdelisle - (11:49): When it's all signing, you can just start trusting a new key. With encryption it's more difficult.

cjdelisle - (11:50): PGP offers key recovery where a piece of the key is given to each of a number of trusted parties but that's for disk crypto.
